projects.description: MACFin maintains budet and expenses for States and Federal Govt. for Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP).
projects.group: DHHS / CMS / OA / CMCS / DSG / DBES
projects.longDescription: The Medicaid and CHIP Financial (MACFin) system is continuing its evolution as the modernized solution for CMS and States to improve the accuracy of over $900 billion in annual state-reported budget and expenditure data, and is essential for Federal and state administration of the Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP).  It empowers Federal and state administration to evolve efficiently with ongoing programmatic and technological changes.  MACFin has improved the technology, functionality, and efficiency of the existing financial processes, thus providing a consolidated solution to Medicaid and CHIP financial administration and oversight.  MACFin is iteratively assuming responsibilities and business functions previously provided by the existing Medicaid and CHIP Budget and Expenditure (MBES/CBES) system, has integrated the Incurred But Not Reported Survey (IBNRS) system and processes, and is integrating and automating financial management processes external to MBES/CBES and IBNRS.
projects.name: MACFin

projects.description: RecordLock provides record locking functionality to prevent multiple users from updating the same information simultaneously for MACFin.
projects.group: DHHS / CMS / OA / CMCS / DSG / DBES

It empowers Federal and state administration to evolve efficiently with ongoing programmatic and technological changes.  MACFin has improved the technology, functionality, and efficiency of the existing financial processes, thus providing a consolidated solution to Medicaid and CHIP financial administration and oversight.  MACFin is iteratively assuming responsibilities and business functions previously provided by the existing Medicaid and CHIP Budget and Expenditure (MBES/CBES) system, has integrated the Incurred But Not Reported Survey (IBNRS) system and processes, and is integrating and automating financial management processes external to MBES/CBES and IBNRS.

projects.description: The Scorecard aims improve public transparency about the administration and outcomes of the Medicaid and CHIP programs.
projects.longDescription: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) developed the Medicaid and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP) Scorecard to improve public transparency about the administration and outcomes of these programs. States and CMS can use the Medicaid and CHIP (MAC) Scorecard to drive improvements in areas such as state and federal alignment, beneficiary health outcomes, and program administration.
projects.name: MACScorecard

projects.description: The Scorecard aims improve public transparency about the administration and outcomes of the Medicaid and CHIP programs
projects.longDescription: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) developed the Medicaid and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP) Scorecard to improve public transparency about the administration and outcomes of these programs. States and CMS can use the Medicaid and CHIP (MAC) Scorecard to drive improvements in areas such as state and federal alignment, beneficiary health outcomes, and program administration. This code takes data input and adds that to data.medicaid.gov, which is the data repository for the MAC Scorecard.
projects.name: MACScorecard-ETL

projects.description: The Scorecard aims improve public transparency about the administration and outcomes of the Medicaid and CHIP programs
projects.longDescription: The Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) developed the Medicaid and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP) Scorecard to improve public transparency about the administration and outcomes of these programs. States and CMS can use the Medicaid and CHIP (MAC) Scorecard to drive improvements in areas such as state and federal alignment, beneficiary health outcomes, and program administration.
projects.name: MACScorecard-Frontend

projects.description: Abt code for data pipeline to create MLR-related dashboards.
projects.name: MLR

projects.description: The Kafka streaming platform for CMS
projects.longDescription: Bigmac is an event streaming platform based on Apache Kafka that uses the Serverless Framework and GitHub Actions to deploy a secure and scalable architecture to AWS. It serves as a central hub for any amount of data to be published or read in real time as part of CMS' new data strategy. The platform enables new services and solutions by extracting CMS data from traditional systems and making it available through modern, scalable, and performant Kafka technology. It provides capabilities for data streaming, replay, and recoverability, allowing the replay of every data event from the beginning of time.
projects.name: bigmac

projects.longDescription: This repo contains all code needed to generate the Behavioral Health Data Book; including reading in codeset Excel workbooks, processing TAF DE and claims, flagging treatment for and service use related to substance use and mental health disorders, and generating output tables for reporting. Note: For 2022 BH Data Book, source code is in individual SUD and MH repos (archived).
projects.name: da-bh-databook

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to build analytic output for CMMI data briefs using TAF
projects.name: da-cmmi-briefs

projects.longDescription: This is a package to calculate data quality measures on T-MSIS Analytic Files (TAF) using SAS
projects.name: da-dq-atlas-automation

projects.longDescription: DQ Atlas is an interactive web tool for exploring the quality and usability of the Transformed Medicaid Statistical Information System (T-MSIS) Analytic Files (TAF). This portion of the project uses C# code to generate 508 compliant PDFs - input files as json and output as pdf. Requires .NET and iText 7 library.
projects.name: da-dq-atlas-backgroundmethods

projects.longDescription: This is a package to calculate data quality measures on T-MSIS Analytic Files (TAF) using Python
projects.name: da-dq-atlas-measures

projects.description: a centralized location to build analytics projects from Unwinding, Performance Indicators, and CTAC data
projects.longDescription: The Eligibility and Enrollment repository is a centralized location to build analytics projects from the following data sources: COVID Unwinding Data, State Performance Indicators, and Coverage Transition Analysis Capabilities (CTAC). Current projects contained are: Renewals Compliance
projects.name: da-ee-analytics

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to generate the TAF-based EPSDT 416-T reports
projects.name: da-epsdt-taf-replication

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to generate the datasets that support the Health Equity Dashboard and Issue briefs
projects.name: da-equity-analytics

projects.description: This repository will contain an archive of code and methodology documentation used to respond to DataConnect support desk analytic requests. The purpose of this repository is to promote open sharing of prior request methods to enhance productivity on answering future requests.
projects.longDescription: Repository containing supporting materials (code, technical specifications) for DataConnect Support Team data request tickets.
projects.name: da-macdc-support-team-data-requests

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to generate the Money Follows the Person (MFP) Transition Report output
projects.name: da-mfp-quarterly-reports

projects.longDescription: This code creates an input for the duals benchmarking measures for Data Quality Measures (DQM). The duals benchmarking measures compare the dual population reported in T-MSIS to the MMA (Medicaid Modernization Act) data reported by states.
projects.name: da-mma-duals

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to generate the Per Capita analysis and reporting data using TAF
projects.name: da-per-capita-analysis

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to generate the Pregnancy Episodes and Outcomes File (PEOF)
projects.name: da-pregnancy-outcomes

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to generate the Race/Ethnicity Imputation TAF companion file
projects.name: da-rei-taf-companion

projects.longDescription: This repo generates a metadata output file used by some downstream TAF ingestors, containing information on source and output variable mappings within TAF. This process also serves as a tertiary QC of TAF Data Dictionary changes
projects.name: da-taf-dd-sttm

projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code to build analytic output for TAF Data Quality briefs
projects.name: da-taf-dq-briefs

projects.longDescription: This repo contains code to generate subsets of TAF and then compare those subsets to the production component. This serves as an independent check on implementation correctness for changes in TAF business logic.
projects.name: da-taf-ivv

projects.longDescription: This project holds post-production QC code used to generate QC materials for a TAF run. It produces a variety of output meant to be reviewed by policy SMEs to QC that the TAF run was analytically successful and identify input data anomalies for further investigation.
projects.name: da-taf-post-production

projects.longDescription: This repository functions as a central and organized location for storing and maintaining TAF operational production utilities
projects.name: da-taf-utilities

projects.description: The Demonstration Evaluation and Management Oversight System (DEMOS) supports the administration of the Medicaid Section 1115 demonstration program
projects.longDescription: The Demonstration Evaluation and Management Oversight System (DEMOS) supports the administration of the demonstration program under Medicaid Section 1115 of the Social Security Act (also known as ‘1115 waivers’). The system collects and produces data and descriptive information about Section 1115 applications submitted by states, and supports CMS’ review and approval of the applications, as well as monitoring and evaluation of approved demonstrations and budget neutrality.
projects.name: demos-qa-automation

projects.longDescription: DQ Atlas is an interactive web tool for exploring the quality and usability of the Transformed Medicaid Statistical Information System (T-MSIS) Analytic Files (TAF). This portion of the project was generated using Python and Flask framework. Includes core module containing application logic, apis module containing REST API code, SQL scripts, testing and non-code assets.
projects.name: dq-atlas-backend

projects.longDescription: DQ Atlas is an interactive web tool for exploring the quality and usability of the Transformed Medicaid Statistical Information System (T-MSIS) Analytic Files (TAF). This portion of the project was generated using Angular 8.0.3 is part of a larger project including an aws backend and an internal charting library. Testing includes unit tests, API testing, E2E, and visual regression testing. Application Performance Monitoring is also included through New Relic.
projects.name: dq-atlas-frontend

projects.description: Python Implementation of T-MSIS Data Quality Measures
projects.longDescription: This is a Python Library for the maintenance and processing of T-MSIS Data Quality (DQ) Measures
projects.name: dq_measures_python

projects.longDescription: The LTSS Measures repository contains code for producing the user and exenditure counts for the LTSS Analytics and Reporting project.
projects.name: ltss-measures

projects.description: This repo contains code related to DSO metrics reporting.
projects.longDescription: This repo contains code related to DSO metrics reporting. It is part of the MAC-FC project, which aims to enhance the visibility of security metrics within the MACBIS organization.
projects.name: mac-fc-dso-metrics

projects.description: This repo stores configuration files for gathering DSO Metrics events for CMCS teams. Config files for each team are located in configs/<team>/<app>/<config-name>.yml. Each team chooses whatever app names are convenient for the organization of your configs.
projects.longDescription: This repo stores the program cmd/process-config that takes 1 config file as an input. Config files for each team are located in configs/<team>/<app>/<config-name>.yml. The program runs the command scan-github wh which must be available via $PATH.
projects.name: mac-fc-dso-metrics-configs

projects.description: This repo is used to test different CDK and Security Sync Proof-Of-Concepts (POCs) for MACBIS teams.
projects.longDescription: This repo is used to test different CDK and Security Sync Proof-Of-Concepts (POCs) for MACBIS teams.
projects.name: mac-fc-embedded

projects.description: This repo contains tools that process and analyze cost data for the MACBIS program.
projects.longDescription: This repo contains tools that process and analyze cost data for the MACBIS program. The data drives the Cost Analysis Dashboard (CAD) and the GitHub Actions Minutes dashboard.
projects.name: mac-fc-macbis-cost-analysis

projects.description: The Developer Portal is a standalone web app that allows authorized users to post API specifications
projects.longDescription: The Developer Portal is a standalone web app that allows authorized users to read API specifications and post new and updated specs to the Portal.
projects.name: mac-fc-macbis-developer-portal

projects.description: A multi-functional DevSecFinOps (DSFO) observability tool for MACBIS product teams and CMS stakeholders
projects.longDescription: ProfessorMAC is a centralized observability tool empowering government leaders and technology contractors to seamlessly monitor and optimize cost, security, and DevOps maturity across diverse infrastructure landscapes. By bridging the gaps in visibility across teams, ProfessorMAC empowers CMS to deliver MACBIS products at lower costs with informed, data-driven decisions. ProfessorMAC provides insight into Cost Management, Security, and DevSecOps.
projects.name: mac-fc-professor-mac

projects.description: Racer is a tool designed to manage temporary access to private codebases for companies bidding on a contract.
projects.longDescription: Racer is a tool designed to manage temporary access to private codebases for companies bidding on a contract. It creates isolated copies of repositories for each bidder while removing sensitive historical information..
projects.name: mac-fc-racer

projects.description: An API with endpoints for current MACBIS teams, accounts, users, and roles.
projects.longDescription: An API that is used by MAC-FC applications to manage and retrieve information about teams, accounts, users, and roles within the MACBIS system. It is a centralized service for accessing and manipulating team-related data.
projects.name: mac-fc-teams-api

projects.description: This repository contains Databricks-compatible artifacts including notebooks, scripts, and execution modules required for DataConnect's data processing pipeline implementation and analytics workflows.
projects.longDescription: This repository is for DataConnect's internal use to house Notebooks and other code that we need to run in Databricks.
projects.name: macdc-databricks-notebooks

projects.description: Python Adaptive Library Engineering Toolkit
projects.longDescription: Python Adaptive Library Engineering Toolkit. The DataConnect Query Engine was created to aid users in creating curated data ready for analysis. The Query Engine allows users to quickly and easily use existing modules to create custom queries and create meaningful datasets that can power analyses and dashboards.
projects.name: macdc-dqe

projects.description: This repository maintains the source code for DataConnect's extract-transform-load operations, including data transformation modules, pipeline definitions, and associated orchestration processes.
projects.longDescription: This repository is where DataConnect is putting all of its ETL code and processes.
projects.name: macdc-etl

projects.description: This repository maintains AWS Lambda function implementations for the DataConnect architecture, serving as both source control and deployment staging area for Lambda deployment packages.
projects.longDescription: This repo is the home of all of the DataConnect project's Lambda functions and acts as a staging ground for lambda packages to be placed in an S3 bucket for deployment via Terraform configurations in the macdc-terraform repo.
projects.name: macdc-lambdas

projects.description: This repository functions as the centralized infrastructure-as-code repository containing all Terraform modules, configurations, and deployment specifications for the DataConnect project infrastructure stack.
projects.longDescription: This repository serves as the central hub for all Terraform configurations related to the DataConnect project.
projects.name: macdc-terraform

projects.description: This repository contains discrete automation modules that don't align with the macdc-terraform codebase or other specialized repositories. Each directory represents a standalone technical implementation organized for maintainability and clear separation of concerns.
projects.longDescription: The root level of the repo should only have global config files (like .flake8 and .gitignore) and folders that each have a single purpose. The folders should be for somewhat small automation projects that don't belong in the macdc-terraform repo and don't belong in any other specific repo. CI, linting, unit tests and other automation applying to the things in this repo should be applied to each single purpose folder individually and not this repo as a whole. The reason for these folders being single purpose is portability. If you feel it's warranted, when any of these small automation projects outgrow this repo they could easily be migrated to their own dedicated repo.
projects.name: macdc-tools-automation

projects.description: A collection of enterprise-ready AWS CDK constructs developed by MACFC for secure, compliant, and efficient cloud infrastructure deployment.
projects.longDescription: A collection of enterprise-ready AWS CDK constructs developed by MACFC for secure, compliant, and efficient cloud infrastructure deployment.
projects.name: macfc-cdk-construct

projects.longDescription: The Medicaid and CHIP Financial (MACFin) system is continuing its evolution as the modernized solution for CMS and States to improve the accuracy of over $900 billion in annual state-reported budget and expenditure data, and is essential for Federal and state administration of the Medicaid program and Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP).  It empowers Federal and state administration to evolve efficiently with ongoing programmatic and technological changes.  MACFin has improved the technology, functionality, and efficiency of the existing financial processes, thus providing a consolidated solution to Medicaid and CHIP financial administration and oversight.  MACFin is iteratively assuming responsibilities and business functions previously provided by the existing Medicaid and CHIP Budget and Expenditure (MBES/CBES) system, has integrated the Incurred But Not Reported Survey (IBNRS) system and processes, and is integrating and automating financial management processes external to MBES/CBES and IBNRS.
projects.name: macfin-audit-service

projects.description: Code to support e14 analysis for MACLC Task 5.7
projects.longDescription: This repository contains Python/PySpark code designed to build analytical tables for evaluating various renewal and disenrollment outcomes following state implementation of strategies related to unwinding, as authorized under section 1902(e)(14)(A) (commonly referred to as e14 waivers). The goal is to assess the effectiveness of these waivers in enhancing beneficiary renewal success.
projects.name: maclc-e14-analysis

projects.longDescription: This repository houses code for the Eligibilty and Enrollment (E&E) Tool, which generates the Medicaid and CHIP Enrollment Operations and Eligibility (E&E) Snapshot in the DataConnect environment.
projects.name: maclc-ee-tool

projects.longDescription: This repo houses code for digesting and cleaning compliance report data submitted by states. This is done using python, funneled through Databricks, and can be run on an ad hoc basis using src/run_submission_pipeline.py.
projects.name: maclc-full-renewal-compliance

projects.description: Code to support ad hoc requests for MACLC Task 5.7
projects.longDescription: This repository houses code used to support analyses related to the MACLC Task 5.7. Generally "ad hoc" requests are particularly urgent, likely to only be needed once, and/or answer specific research questions and so don't require a more general product.
projects.name: maclc-maf-ad-hoc

projects.longDescription: This repository houses code for generation of analytic files and Excel-based reports using performance indicator (PI) and eligiblity processing (EP) data in the DataConnect environment.
projects.name: maclc-maf-data-production

projects.description: CTAC TAF DQ Checks
projects.longDescription: Python scripts to perform data quality checks on the TAF data.
projects.name: maclc-taf-dq-checks

projects.description: A web-based platform for state submissions and management of various Medicaid programs including Health Home State Plan Amendments, Recovery Audit Contractor Reports, and Payment Suspensions.
projects.longDescription: The Medicaid Model Data Lab (MMDL) is a comprehensive web-based platform that enables state Medicaid programs to prepare, submit, and review various types of submissions and reports. The application includes modules for Health Home State Plan Amendment (HHS), Medicaid Recovery Audit Contractor (RAC) Reports, Medicaid Payment Suspensions - State Annual Reports, and Balancing Incentive Program (BIP) submissions. Built with Java/J2EE technology stack including JSP, Struts, EJB, and Oracle database, MMDL provides a centralized portal for state users to access documentation, training materials, and submit required Medicaid program data to CMS.
projects.name: macpro-mmdl

projects.description: State Early Alert (SEA) Tool for managing and tracking Medicaid state plan amendments, waivers, and demonstrations through the CMS review and approval process.
projects.longDescription: The State Early Alert (SEA) Tool is a comprehensive web application that enables CMS central office and regional office staff to manage, track, and approve various types of Medicaid state submissions including State Plan Amendments (SPA), 1115 Demonstration Waivers, 1915(b) and 1915(c) Home and Community-Based Services Waivers, CHIP amendments, Advance Planning Documents (APD), Administrative (ADM) forms, and Upper Payment Limit (UPL) forms. Built with ASP.NET MVC and C#, the system provides complex workflow management with status tracking, role-based access control, automated reporting and notifications, comprehensive audit trails, and multi-environment support. The application serves as a critical component of the Medicaid infrastructure, ensuring proper oversight and timely processing of state submissions that impact healthcare coverage for millions of Americans. The system includes sophisticated business rules, validation logic, automated email alerts, extensive reporting capabilities, and user management features that support the complex regulatory requirements of Medicaid program administration.
projects.name: macpro-seatool

projects.description: This tool pulls findings from AWS Security Hub in all the accounts present in the teammap and outputs them in an s3 bucket.
projects.longDescription: This tool pulls findings from AWS Security Hub in all the accounts present in the teammap and outputs them in an s3 bucket.The report could be downloaded from the s3 bucket and fed to the security-hub-monitor for GUI visualization. In order to use this tool, you will need to have valid AWS credentials in your environment (or provide a profile for the tool to use).
projects.name: macpro-securityhub-collector

projects.description: Waiver Management System (WMS) for managing Section 1915(c) Home and Community Based Services (HCBS) waivers and Section 1915(b) waivers for state Medicaid agencies.
projects.longDescription: The Waiver Management System (WMS) is a comprehensive web-based application that supports the complete lifecycle management of Medicaid waivers under Section 1915(c) and 1915(b) of the Social Security Act. The system enables state Medicaid agencies to create, submit, and manage waiver applications for Home and Community Based Services (HCBS) that allow individuals to receive long-term care services in their homes and communities rather than in institutional settings. Built on Java/J2EE technology with JSP web interfaces and Oracle database backend, the system provides sophisticated workflow management for waiver applications, amendments, and renewals. It supports multiple user types including state users, CMS Regional Office staff, and CMS Central Office reviewers, each with role-based permissions and access controls. Key features include comprehensive waiver application forms based on CMS templates, electronic submission and approval workflows, mandatory annual CMS-372 reporting capabilities, document version control, audit trails, and extensive reporting and analytics. The system ensures compliance with federal regulations while streamlining the complex process of waiver management for both states and CMS reviewers.
projects.name: macpro-wms

projects.description: Mono repo used to host Medicaid Drug Program application and infrastructure code
projects.longDescription: Mono repo used to host Medicaid Drug Program application, infrastructure, and testing code.
projects.name: mdp-application

projects.longDescription: Automated testing framework used to run after the MDP Rebate Calculation process completes to validate the results of the run.
projects.name: mdp-rc-automation

projects.longDescription: The main goal of this repo is to validate the outputs of the RC and BPD process and evaluate the data quality of the inputs using sqlmesh
projects.name: mdp-rc-validation

projects.longDescription: This is a temporary repo used as a proof of concept using sqlmesh to validate the data outputs of the DUR process that is polled from qualtrics surveys filled out and into the MDP system.
projects.name: mdp-survey-validation

projects.description: A microservice sending CMS Medicaid Model Data Lab (MMDL) data to CMS Bigmac.
projects.longDescription: The mmdl-connectors project is a production microservice deployed to AWS that streams CMS Medicaid Model Data Lab (MMDL) data from Oracle database to CMS Bigmac's Kafka cluster in real-time. It leverages Kafka Connect service deployed to ECS Fargate with a JDBC Source connector that monitors MMDL's Oracle database for data changes and streams them to topics in CMS Bigmac. The system includes multiple integrated services: connector service for data streaming, ksqlDB for data processing and table creation, alerts service for monitoring, and dashboard service for visualization. AWS Lambda functions handle topic creation, deployment operations, and configuration management. The architecture includes automated password management with EventBridge handlers that respond to AWS Secrets Manager changes, ensuring continuous operation during scheduled maintenance windows. The solution provides real-time healthcare data analytics capabilities for CMS Medicaid operations with comprehensive monitoring through AWS CloudWatch and automated alerting systems.
projects.name: mmdl-connectors

projects.description: This repository contains the code for the data pipeline that produces the data for the Performance Indicators Dashboard.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code for the data pipeline that produces the data for the Performance Indicators Dashboard. This pipeline runs in the CMCS DataConnect Databricks environment. The output data is consumed by DataConnect QuickSight for use in the dashboard.  See CMS Enterprise Confluence for more information about this dashboard, https://confluenceent.cms.gov/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=DATC&title=Performance+Indicator+%28PI%29+Dashboard.
projects.name: pi-dashboard-pipeline

projects.description: This repository contains the code for the performance indicator data quality pipeline that runs data quality (DQ) checks for state's monthly Performance Indicator data.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains the code for the performance indicator data quality pipeline that runs data quality (DQ) checks for state's monthly Performance Indicator data. This pipeline runs in the CMCS DataConnect Databricks environment. The PI DQ check output is displayed in a Databricks Dashboard and is utilized by state leads for review of monthly performance indicator data and state communication.
projects.name: pi-data-quality-pipeline

projects.description: T-MSIS collects state Medicaid data, validates it, and processes it in EMR after successful receipt and control checks.
projects.longDescription: The [Transformed Medicaid Statistical Information} System](https://www.medicaid.gov/medicaid/data-and-systems/macbis/tmsis/index.html) (T-MSIS) receives claims and eligibility data from states via EFT, acknowledges the receipt and reports any errors via Receipt and Control, then kicks off a processing pipeline in Elastic Map Reduce (EMR) if all R+C checks are successful.
projects.name: tmsis

projects.description: The alerter is an application that is passed in alert data.
projects.longDescription: The alerter is an application that is passed in alert data.  It will then read in a list of subscription documents from a data source (see below).  The application will combine the alert and relative subscription information and pass it to a sender that will send out a formatted message to whereever it is suppose to, currently Slack.

projects.description: This repository contains several tools used for AREMAC and T-MSIS deployments.

projects.description: This repository contains devops used tools.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains tools used for DevSecOps in the TMSIS project.
projects.name: tmsis-devsecops-tools

projects.description: Various diagrams for TMSIS.
projects.longDescription: Various diagrams for TMSIS including the engineering diagrams used in Confluence.
projects.name: tmsis-diagrams

projects.description: The Dispatcher component runs in the background continously responding to async events within the TMSIS application.
projects.longDescription: The Dispatcher component runs in the background continously responding to async events within the TMSIS application.
projects.name: tmsis-dispatcher

projects.description: The ETL program processes files from Mathematica and updates the DQT database with new data.
projects.longDescription: The ETL program processes files from the Mathematica team and updates the Data Quality Tool database with the new data.
projects.name: tmsis-dqt-etl

projects.description: This repository contains frontend for the Data Quality Tool application.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains the Generic Export pipeline.
projects.name: tmsis-dqt-webapp

projects.description: DQT WebService
projects.longDescription: DQT WebService is a web service that provides access to the Data Quality Tool (DQT) database. It allows users to query and retrieve data from the DQT database, which contains information about the quality of Medicaid and CHIP data submitted by states.
projects.name: tmsis-dqt-webservices

projects.description: This repository contains Go code shared by the AREMAC and T-MSIS projects.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains Go code shared by the AREMAC and T-MSIS projects. It includes utilities for secrets management and other common functionalities used across these projects.
projects.name: tmsis-go

projects.description: This repository contains terragrunt and terraform modules for TMSIS infrastructure.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains terragrunt and terraform modules for TMSIS infrastructure as well as container definitions for clamav-scan and github-runner
projects.name: tmsis-infra

projects.description: IQ Metrics in file processing pipeline implemented by spark
projects.longDescription: IQ Metrics in file processing pipeline implemented by spark
projects.name: tmsis-iq-metrics

projects.description: Jenkins Job Definitions and Scripts
projects.longDescription: Jenkins Job Definitions and Scripts for TMSIS
projects.name: tmsis-jenkins

projects.description: Project for Airflow MWAA POC
projects.longDescription: Project for Airflow MWAA POC
projects.name: tmsis-mwaa

projects.description: Ancienct repository with COBOL from MSIS days
projects.longDescription: This repository contains the MSIS Link Key code from the TMSIS Non-Prod environment. It is an ancient repository with COBOL code from the MSIS days targeting old IBM 3090 mainframes. It is not used in TMSIS and is not maintained.
projects.name: tmsis-nonprod-msis_link_key

projects.description: Experimental code and handy common snippets
projects.longDescription: Experimental code and handy common snippets
projects.name: tmsis-nonprod-scratch

projects.description: This project is a Python-based API that leverages FastAPI for building web services.
projects.longDescription: This project, tmsis-oba-api, is a Python-based API that leverages FastAPI for building web services.
projects.name: tmsis-oba-api

projects.description: The OD component serves the TMSIS dashboard within the TMSIS application.
projects.longDescription: The OD component serves the TMSIS dashboard within the TMSIS application.
projects.name: tmsis-od

projects.description: OD Tests
projects.longDescription: OD Tests for TMSIS
projects.name: tmsis-od-tests

projects.description: A collection of common github actions for pipelines.
projects.longDescription: This contains a variety of pipeline action runners such as; container-deploy, container-scanner, linters, notify-slack, run-all-linters, sonarqube
projects.name: tmsis-pipeline-actions

projects.description: Provider link key
projects.longDescription: This contains a variety of pipeline action runners such as; container-deploy, container-scanner, linters, notify-slack, run-all-linters, sonarqube
projects.name: tmsis-provider-link-key

projects.description: Receipt and Control is the system for detecting new T-MSIS files in S3.
projects.longDescription: Receipt and Control is the system for detecting new T-MSIS files in S3. It then ingests them into the system for later processing and generates ACK reports. The reports verify the basic formatting of the file and send back information about the file that was received to the state that submitted it.
projects.name: tmsis-rc-docker

projects.description: This repository incorporates the Security Hub GitHub Action to automate the syncing process of Jira tickets with AWS Security Hub.
projects.longDescription: This repository incorporates the Security Hub GitHub Action to automate the syncing process of Jira tickets with AWS Security Hub.
projects.name: tmsis-security-hub

projects.description: This repository contain scripts that integrates with AWS Security Hub and Jira.
projects.longDescription: This repository contain scripts that integrates with AWS Security Hub and Jira. Currently, it retrieves findings from AWS Security Hub, filters them based on specific criteria, and creates or updates Jira issues accordingly.
projects.name: tmsis-security-hub-jira-reporter

projects.description: The MACBIS Shared repository holds code and configuration shared between the DataConnect project and the T-MSIS project.
projects.longDescription: The MACBIS Shared repository holds code and configuration shared between the DataConnect project and the T-MSIS project.
projects.name: tmsis-shared

projects.description: A tests for file processing in TMSIS.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains tests for file processing in TMSIS. It is used to ensure that the file processing system works correctly and efficiently.
projects.name: tmsis-test-file-processing

projects.description: A collection of terraform modules for TMSIS.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains a collection of Terraform modules used in the TMSIS project. These modules are designed to facilitate the deployment and management of infrastructure resources in a consistent and reusable manner.
projects.name: tmsis-tf-modules

projects.description: This repository contains regression tests for TMSIS.
projects.longDescription: This repository contains regression tests for TMSIS. It is used to ensure that the TMSIS system works correctly and efficiently after changes or updates.
projects.name: tmsis_regresison_tests
